class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">CrowdCasts Monthly: Mitigating Pass the Hash</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save CrowdCasts Monthly: Mitigating Pass the Hash for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdfcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdfcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdfcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdfcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdfcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Sixteen years later and Pass the Hash (PtH) is still one of the most common techniques a targeted attacker can use to compromise a network. There have been many blogs, webinars, and papers covering different PtH mitigation strategies. With all the information about this particular security vulnerability, networks are still continuously attacked and infiltrated using this technique. It is time to look at the problem from a holistic approach and apply the communities&#x27; collective intelligence to make this process one of the most difficult for a targeted attacker to use. </span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1fcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1fcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-15" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1gcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1gcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1gcbjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/endtoend-analysis-of-a-domain-generating/25244628"><span class="sr-only">End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:15" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/end-to-endanalysisofadomaingeneratingalgorithmmalwarefamily-slides-130814103104-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdgcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdgcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdgcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdgcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdgcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes the analysis of a domain generating algorithm (DGA) malware family. Key points include:

- The malware uses inline code obfuscation and encrypted strings to hide its functionality and communication domains. Researchers were able to deobfuscate the code and decrypt the strings to analyze the malware. 

- Clues in decrypted strings suggest the malware author is Romani, including references to Romani singers in template strings. 

- The malware generates domain names by concatenating two randomly selected words from a dictionary and appending &quot;.net&quot;. This allows it to generate many domain variations to communicate with its command and control servers.

- The DGA algorithm uses a 15-bit seed value derived from the</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1gcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1gcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-16" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1hcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1hcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1hcbjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/tor-all-the-things/25244568"><span class="sr-only">TOR... ALL THE THINGS</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:16" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130814102922-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130814102922-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">TOR... ALL THE THINGS</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save TOR... ALL THE THINGS for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdhcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdhcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdhcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdhcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdhcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The global Tor network and its routing protocols provide an excellent framework for online anonymity. However, the selection of Tor-friendly software for Windows is sub-par at best. 

Want to anonymously browse the web? You’re stuck with Firefox, and don’t even think about trying to anonymously use Flash. Want to dynamically analyze malware without letting the C2 server know your home IP address? You’re outta luck. Want to anonymously use any program that doesn’t natively support SOCKS or HTTP proxying? Not gonna happen. 

While some solutions currently exist for generically rerouting traffic through Tor, these solutions either don’t support Windows, or can be circumvented by malware, or require an additional network gateway device. 

Missed the live session at Black Hat USA 2013? Check out the slides from Jason Geffner&#x27;s standing room only presentation! Jason released a free new CrowdStrike community tool to securely, anonymously, and transparently route all TCP/IP and DNS traffic through Tor, regardless of the client software, and without relying on VPNs or additional hardware or virtual machines.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1hcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1hcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-17" aria-haspopup="dialog" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike/end-toend-analysis-of-a-domain-generating-algorithm-malware-family-whitepaper"><span class="sr-only">End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family Whitepaper</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:17" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family Whitepaper</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family Whitepaper for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdicbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdicbjnf6:" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdicbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdicbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document provides an overview of domain generating algorithms (DGAs) used by malware to dynamically determine remote server addresses and evade detection. It details the analysis performed on a malware family submitted to CrowdStrike, including deobfuscating the binary, analyzing its DGA and network functionality, sinkholing domains, and investigating the malware author. The family has been active for at least six years and infects thousands of devices.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1icbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1icbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-18" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1jcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1jcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1jcbjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/tor-all-the-things-whitepaper/25207431"><span class="sr-only">TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:18" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130813094128-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130813094128-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdjcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdjcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdjcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdjcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdjcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document introduces Tortilla, software designed to allow security researchers to safely and anonymously interact with hostile servers and actors online. It discusses how traditional malware research was more passive, but now requires actively monitoring adversary infrastructure. The Tor network and Tor Browser Bundle are described as existing solutions for anonymity, but they have limitations like only supporting the Firefox browser and not plugins. Tortilla aims to address these issues by providing a more robust anonymity solution.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1jcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1jcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-19" aria-haspopup="dialog" Presence of Bootkits</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:19" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">I/O, You Own: Regaining Control of Your Disk in the Presence of Bootkits</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save I/O, You Own: Regaining Control of Your Disk in the Presence of Bootkits for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdkcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdkcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdkcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdkcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdkcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses a technique for regaining control of a disk in the presence of a bootkit by leveraging the crash dump stack in Windows. It provides background on the crash dump stack and how it differs from the normal I/O path. It then describes how identifying and calling the crash dump port and miniport drivers allows sending I/O requests outside of the normal path to bypass bootkit filters and read/write directly to disk. The document concludes with an overview of how this technique can be demonstrated against the TDL4 bootkit.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1kcbjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1kcbjnf6"></div></div><div class="desktop-recs"><div class="Slider_root__c0Jo8"><div class="Slider_scroller__KHjw4"><div BottomRecommendation_root__7aU9w"><h3 class="BottomRecommendation_title__SRj68">Recently uploaded<!-- --> <span class="BottomRecommendation_count__4HpLo">(<!-- -->20<!-- -->)</span></h3><div class="BottomRecommendationContent_root__2qm4_"><div class="mobile-recs"><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-0" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R11ccjnf6:" popovertarget=":R11ccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R11ccjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/saas-product-development-best-practices-pdf/277764912"><span class="sr-only">SaaS Product Development Best Practices</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:0" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="SaaS Product Development Best Practices" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/saasproductdevelopmentbestpractices-250410093351-189f14d6-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="SaaS Product Development Best Practices" class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">SaaS Product Development Best Practices</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save SaaS Product Development Best Practices for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd1ccjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd1ccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd1ccjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd1ccjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd1ccjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/vinaykumarlnb">ApptDev</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">SaaS product development has transformed the software industry into a dynamic ecosystem where innovation, customer-centric design, and rapid iteration shape market success. This presentation explores best practices that empower organizations to build, launch, and scale high-performing SaaS products in today’s competitive digital arena. It begins with an examination of agile methodologies, lean startup principles, and the importance of launching a minimal viable product (MVP) to validate market demand and reduce risk. Through iterative development cycles, teams can continuously refine features based on real user feedback while maintaining flexibility to pivot when necessary.

Strategic planning is emphasized as the cornerstone of sustainable growth. The presentation details how comprehensive market research, rigorous competitor analysis, and a clear product roadmap help align cross-functional teams, from developers and designers to marketing and customer support. Integrated DevOps practices and the adoption of cloud-based architectures further enhance operational efficiency, scalability, and performance. Robust security protocols and compliance measures are also addressed to safeguard data and meet regulatory standards.

A significant portion of the guide is dedicated to leveraging data-driven decision making. Detailed metrics and analytics empower teams to assess user engagement, track product performance, and drive continuous improvements through automation in testing, integration, and deployment. The discussion delves into best practices for managing technical debt, optimizing the development lifecycle, and ensuring that every release adds measurable value. In today’s fast-paced market, the ability to adapt quickly is not optional; it is a necessity that is fostered by iterative testing, proactive customer feedback loops, and strategic risk-taking.

Moreover, this presentation outlines advanced techniques for creating intuitive user experiences (UX), ensuring seamless onboarding, and delivering ongoing customer support that builds trust and enhances loyalty. By merging strategic vision with execution excellence, these best practices offer a comprehensive framework for startups and established enterprises alike, guiding them to achieve long-term success and competitive advantage in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.

Optimized for both innovation and efficiency, this guide serves as an essential resource for product teams aiming to thrive in the SaaS industry. Whether you are refining an existing product or embarking on a new venture, the practices outlined here will help you navigate challenges, seize opportunities, and drive lasting value for your customers.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R11ccjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R11ccjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf chiseling techniques on optimizing growth of cotton...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Effect of fertilizers and chiseling techniques on optimizing growth of cotton... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd2ccjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd2ccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd2ccjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd2ccjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd2ccjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/editoraab14">Advances in Agriculture and Biology</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Cotton contributes significantly to the production of oilseeds and textile fiber globally, and it is an important component of the socioeconomic and political environment. This study aims to evaluate the effects of commercial sulfuric acid and nitrogen, irrigation intervals, phosphatic fertilizer application, and chiseling on cotton growth and yield. The investigation was carried out using a split-plot setup with three replications at the Central Cotton Research Institute (CCRI), Multan, Pakistan. Nitrogen levels (N1 = 50 kg ha-1, N2 = 100 kg ha-1, N3 =150 kg ha-1) were kept in main plots, while sulphuric acid (S1= 0 kg ha-1, S2= 125 kg ha-1, S3 = 250 kg ha-1 and S4 = 375 kg ha-1) was randomized in sub plots respectively. The results showed that watering interval and chiseling had a substantial impact on plant height and the quantity of fruiting parts per plant. Compared to other treatments, interculturing produced higher plant height and more fruiting parts when paired with chiseling and an 8-day irrigation interval. The height and fruiting sections of cotton plants showed a positive link with the long-term effects of phosphatic fertilizer application in wheat crop. The impact of several phosphorus delivery techniques on plant height and fruiting parts varied in bed-furrow planting; hand application without mixing prior to sowing yielded the best results. The application of commercial sulfuric acid, in conjunction with nitrogen, positively affected both plant height and fruiting parts. Increased fruiting parts and plant height were a result of higher sulfuric acid dosages; nitrogen application had no visible impact. These findings can contribute to the development of effective strategies for cotton cultivation, leading to increased productivity and profitability for cotton farmers.
Cotton holds a significant role in various aspects of daily life, impacting human existence from infancy to the end of life. Its influence is universal reaching into socio-economic and political affairs on a global scale (Kairon et al., 2004). The cultivation, processing, and trade of cotton not only serve as sources of substantial revenue but also form the backbone of livelihoods in numerous countries. As the leading natural textile fiber worldwide, cotton also ranks as the fourth largest oilseeds crop, addressing 40 % of the global textile demand and contributing 3.3 % to the overall production of edible oil (Ali et al., 2012; Zia et al., 2015; Shuli et al., 2018). Pakistan stands prominently as the fourth largest contributor to global cotton production, emphasizing its crucial role in the cotton industry (Zia et al., 2018a, 2018b). Additionally, it holds the third position in consumption and distinguishes itself as a leading exporter of yarn (International Cotton Advisory Committee [ICAC], 2012). </span></div></div><div class="" id=":R12ccjnf6:" popover="manual" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R12ccjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-2" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R13ccjnf6:" popovertarget=":R13ccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R13ccjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/sap-automation-with-uipath-leveraging-ai-for-sap-automation-part-8-of-8/277779785"><span class="sr-only">SAP Automation with UiPath: Leveraging AI for SAP Automation - Part 8 of 8</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:2" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="SAP Automation with UiPath: Leveraging AI for SAP Automation - Join us for this engaging &#x27;Meet &amp; Greet&#x27; event, where you&#x27;ll have the opportunity to connect with fellow RPA enthusiasts, industry professionals, and AI innovators.
In this introductory session, we&#x27;ll delve into the fascinating world of agentic AI, exploring how AI-powered agents are revolutionizing automation by bringing intelligence, autonomy, and decision-making capabilities to RPA workflows.

📕 What to expect:
Networking opportunities with the UiPath Community in Scotland
A clear and engaging introduction to agentic AI
Interactive Q&amp;A session to clarify your questions and ideas

Whether you&#x27;re an experienced developer, a business leader, or completely new to automation, come along to learn, share, and connect.
Let&#x27;s innovate together with UiPath Community Scotland!
Speaker/Chapter Leader:
👨‍🏫Gunashekhar Kotla, UiPath MVP,  AI Automation Consultant @EY

class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ScottSosna">Scott Sosna</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Really, data modeling? Is that even a thing any more?

The days of formal data modeling are definitely years in the rearview mirror, empowered teams define their data as they see fit, implement, and move on. Done. And we&#x27;ll deal with short-comings down the road when they arise, that&#x27;s Agile, let&#x27;s keep moving forward (to data architects&#x27; frustration when trying to make sense of it all after the fact).

But &quot;modeling data&quot; extends beyond what is persisted in a database server: API Payloads, messages, configuration files, document metadata, Redis indexes are forms of data we define and work with regularly.

If I&#x27;ve got your attention, join me to discuss data modeling, this time from a software engineering perspective!</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R19ccjnf6:" popover="manual" class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This webinar explores emerging trends in the types of books Canadians are buying. Using the most up-to-date data, we find out if Romantasy titles are still flying off the shelves at a feverish pace, whether Taylor Swift can sell books as well as she sells concert tickets, and how other sociocultural and demographic shifts are reflected in book-buying behaviour. BookNet Canada’s SalesData &amp; LibraryData team, Lily Dwyer and Kalpna Patel, dig deep into the data to show you which subjects are on the move.

ADVERSARY </a> PROBLEM.
Who’s Targeting You and Why?

 </li></div><div><li>3. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#3">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
ADAM MEYERS |
VP, INTELLIGENCE
Recognized speaker, trainer, and intelligence expert with 15+ years
of cyber security industry experience
10 years in the DIB supporting US GOV customers on topics
ranging from wireless, pen testing, IR, and malware analysis

@ADAM_CYBER

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

3

 </li></div><div><li>4. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#4">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
MATT DAHL |
SENIOR ANALYST/ LEGAL COUNSEL
Cyber threat analyst focused on targeted intrusion activity
Focused on investigating indicators of compromise to identify
specific adversary activity
Legal liaison to the CrowdStrike Intelligence Team

@CROWDSTRIKE

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

4

 </li></div><div><li>5. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#5">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversaries </a> are humans
Targeted Attackers:

WHO ARE THE
ADVERSARIES?

Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
They need to get in
They will likely need to move laterally

Spray and Pray (Prey):
They don’t care who they target
(sometimes what)
The more they compromise the
more they win
Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

5

Tactics, Techniques, and Practices

Between indicators

4

compromise of US financial

participation in

23.19.122.202; 192.154.108.10;

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

However, organizations are still struggling to understand how they can prioritize the development of hunt hypothesis, assess their current security posture, and develop the right analytics with the help of ATT\u0026CK. Even though there are several ways to utilize ATT\u0026CK to accomplish those goals, there are only a few that are focusing primarily on the data that is currently being collected to drive the success of a hunt program. \r\n\r\nThis presentation shows how organizations can benefit from mapping their current visibility from a data perspective to the ATT\u0026CK framework. It focuses on how to identify, document, standardize and model current available data to enhance a hunt program. Why? Because you get one chance to do the eviction of the attacker right. And if you fail, all your efforts will eventually have been for nothing.\r\n\r\nBut for how long should you wait and watch? Whether this is Docker or Kubernetes environments, Lacework Labs has identified adversaries attempting to deploy malicious container images (T1610) , mine Cryptocurrency (T1496), and deploy C2 agents. Defenders new to the container space may be unaware of the built-in capabilities popular container runtime engines have that can help defend against rogue containers being deployed into their environment. Attendees will walk away with an understanding of what these attack patterns look like based on honeypot data Lacework has gathered over the past year, as well as techniques on how to defend their own container focused workloads.","tags":[],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/MITREATTACK/attcking-contianers-in-the-cloud","userLogin":"MITREATTACK","userName":"MITRE ATT\u0026CK","viewCount":744},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Putting MITRE ATT\u0026CK into Action with What You Have, Where You Are","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":46,"score":0.66423,"slideshowId":"143650354","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"putting-mitre-attck-into-action-with-what-you-have-where-you-are","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/nickels-sp4rkcon-mitreattck-190504152848-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"This document provides an overview of Katie Nickels' presentation on putting MITRE ATT\u0026CK into action using available resources. Some key points include:\n- MITRE ATT\u0026CK is a knowledge base of adversary tactics and techniques based on real-world observations. \n- It can be used for detection, assessment, threat intelligence, and adversary emulation.\n- For detection, ATT\u0026CK can help improve focus on post-exploit activity and track gaps/improvements in coverage over time. Existing data sources can be leveraged to detect techniques.\n- For assessment and engineering, ATT\u0026CK can guide decisions around tool selection and help identify visibility and risk acceptance gaps.","tags":[],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/putting-mitre-attck-into-action-with-what-you-have-where-you-are/143650354","userLogin":"KatieNickels","userName":"Katie Nickels","viewCount":13810},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Automating the mundanity of technique IDs with ATT\u0026CK Detections Collector","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":25,"score":0.663693,"slideshowId":"251521612","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"automating-the-mundanity-of-technique-ids-with-attck-detections-collector","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/automatingthemundanityoftechniqueidswithattckdetectionscollector-220406003027-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"From ATT\u0026CKcon 3.0\n\nBy Marcus LaFerrera and Ryan Kovar, Splunk\n\nSince the release of MITRE ATT\u0026CK, vendors and governmental bodies have begun mapping their security blogs, whitepapers, and threat intel reports to ATT\u0026CK TTPs, which is incredible! Vendors have then begun mapping their detections to those mapped TTPs, which is even more awesome! What is not awesome is dissecting a piece of prose for all of the specific embedded ATT\u0026CK technique IDs and then mapping them to your detections to determine coverage. Over the last year, the team at Splunk has spent more time doing this than they would like to admit, so they wrote a tool to do it for them and want to share it with the world.  Join the Splunk team as they tell the world about ATT\u0026CK Detections Collector (ADC). ADC is an open-source python tool that will allow you to extract MITRE technique IDs from a third-party URLs and output them into a file. If you use Splunk, the team even maps them to their existing (previously mapped) detection corpus. They even added the ability to export them into a navigator json for fun, profit, or (at least) better visualization!","tags":[],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/automating-the-mundanity-of-technique-ids-with-attck-detections-collector/251521612","userLogin":"MITREATTACK","userName":"MITRE ATT\u0026CK","viewCount":456},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"2021/0/15 - Solarwinds supply chain attack: why we should take it sereously","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":25,"score":0.661995,"slideshowId":"241484892","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"2021015-solarwinds-supply-chain-attack-why-we-should-take-it-sereously","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/solarwinds-webinar-210118071224-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"In this webinar we explain why the SolarWinds attack is different from all known scenarios and how to protect your company or manufacturing site from it. Act fast, be aware!","tags":["solarwinds supply chain attack","cybersecurity","sirris"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/2021015-solarwinds-supply-chain-attack-why-we-should-take-it-sereously/241484892","userLogin":"sirris_be","userName":"Sirris","viewCount":895},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"ATT\u0026CKing the Red/Blue Divide","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":28,"score":0.658103,"slideshowId":"251521614","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"attcking-the-redblue-divide","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/attckingtheredbluedivide-220406003028-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"From ATT\u0026CKcon 3.0\n\nBy Fred Frey and Jonathan Mulholland, SnapAttack\n\nAtomic Red Team and Sigma are the largest open-source attack simulation and analytic projects. Many organizations utilize one or both internally for security controls validation or supplementing their detections and alerts.  Building on the work from these two great communities, we smashed (scientific-term) the attacks and analytics together and applied data science to analyze the results. We'll describe our methodology and testing framework, show the real-world MITRE ATT\u0026CK coverage and gaps, discuss our algorithms for calculating analytic similarity, identifying log sources for a technique, and determining the best analytics to deploy that maximizes ATT\u0026CK coverage. \n\nThis project aims to: \n- Bring a measurable testing rigor to community analytics to improve adoption \n- Test every analytic against every attack, validating the true positive detection \n- Understand the log sources required to detect specific attack techniques  \n- Apply data science to identify analytic similarity (reduce community duplication) \n- Identify gaps between the projects' analytics without attack simulations; attack simulations without detections; missing or incorrect MITRE ATT\u0026CK labels, etc \n- Automate the process so insights can stay up to date with new attack/analytic contributions over time  \n- Share our analysis back to the community to improve these projects","tags":[],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/attcking-the-redblue-divide/251521614","userLogin":"MITREATTACK","userName":"MITRE ATT\u0026CK","viewCount":853},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"MITRE AttACK framework it is time you took notice_v1.0","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":41,"score":0.654179,"slideshowId":"120835405","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"mitre-attack-framework-it-is-time-you-took-noticev10","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/attckframeworkwhyitmattersv1-181026135050-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Mitre ATT\u0026CK is for all of us, and it is time to pay attention to it.\r\nLOG-MD.com\r\nLOG-MD\r\nMalwareArchaeology.com\r\nMalware Archaeology","tags":["blue team","incident response","malware archaeology"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/mitre-attack-framework-it-is-time-you-took-noticev10/120835405","userLogin":"Hackerhurricane","userName":"Michael Gough","viewCount":3652},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"CapTech Talks--OSINT- Dr. Kellup Charles 10--6-22.pptx","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":49,"score":0.654178,"slideshowId":"253379004","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"captech-talksosint-dr-kellup-charles-10622pptx","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/captechtalks-osintwithdr-221006202222-e9caa656-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"The presentation discusses open-source intelligence (OSINT) techniques. Penetration testers are tasked with simulating targeted attacks on a company's system to determine any weaknesses in their environment. \n\nThe 2021 Summer SE Pen Test Competition allowed students to experience SE pen testing in a safe and ethical way. Student teams were \"hired\" to conduct a SE pen test on the CARE Lab (run by the authors) and their employees (the authors themselves)! Teams had to use OSINT, phishing, and vishing in real-time to target the lab, develop attack playbooks, and map the techniques to the ATT\u0026CK framework. \n\nThis talk shares the application of ATT\u0026CK in cybersecurity education. Specifically, it (i) focuses on how students map their SE attack playbooks to the ATT\u0026CK framework, (ii) compares/contrasts SE techniques across various student groups: 6 graduate teams, 9 undergraduate teams, and 1 high school team, and (iii) how ATT\u0026CK can be used for SE.","tags":[],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/exploring-how-students-map-social-engineering-techniques-to-the-attck-framework-during-a-realtime-cybersecurity-exercise/251521608","userLogin":"MITREATTACK","userName":"MITRE ATT\u0026CK","viewCount":458},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Cyber Threat Intelligence","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":32,"score":0.64866,"slideshowId":"47523086","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"cyber-threat-intelligence-47523086","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/bigsecuritydata-150428120541-conversion-gate02-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"This document discusses cyber threat intelligence and strategies for defense. However, emulating adversary TTPs on production environments is often very limited in testing scope and frequency, and such practice may cause unwanted business disruption. In this talk from the MITRE ATT\u0026CKcon Power Hour session on October 9, 2020, Hart presents a different approach to testing controls against ATT\u0026CK. He demonstrates how it is possible to provide data-based methods to evaluate the exploitability of ATT\u0026CK techniques by gathering information from the network, endpoint, and services; this unique approach does not emulate any sort of malicious action, thus reducing the potential of causing business disruption to the minimum. Hart also outlines a new open-source guideline based on ATT\u0026CK mitigations, that security teams can use to assess their security posture non-intrusively and at scale.","tags":["mitre att\u0026ck","att\u0026ck","attack"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/transforming-adversary-emulation-into-a-data-analysis-question/241296467","userLogin":"attackcon2018","userName":"MITRE - ATT\u0026CKcon","viewCount":440},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"MITRE ATT\u0026CKcon 2018: From Automation to Analytics: Simulating the Adversary ...","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":49,"score":0.642625,"slideshowId":"123180390","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"mitre-attckcon-2018-from-automation-to-analytics-simulating-the-adversary-to-create-better-detections-david-herrald-and-ryan-kovar-splunk","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/2018mitreattckconherraldkovar-181116142318-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Security teams have more detection tools at their disposal than ever before, yet most are still struggling to find even the most basic malicious activity occurring in their environments. about the history of Russian intelligence influence operations and the cyber actors implementing them today.\r\n\r\nIn June 2016, CrowdStrike exposed unprecedented efforts by Russian intelligence services to interfere in the U.S. election via the hacking and subsequent leaking of information from political organizations and individuals. Election manipulation was not a new activity for the Russians - they have engaged in these influence operations consistently for the better part of the last two decades inside and outside of Russia.\r\n\r\nIn this CrowdCast, CrowdStrike experts Adam Meyers, VP of Intelligence, and Dmitri Alperovitch, Co-Founder \u0026 CTO, will provide a detailed overview of the history of Russian intelligence influence operations going back decades and provide a deep dive overview of various BEAR (including FANCY BEAR AND COZY BEAR) intrusion sets and their tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs). The purveyors of ransomware continue to prosper with adversaries developing new strains such as Zepto and Cerber that are proving to be more challenging than ever. Other exploits can alter programmable logic controller (PLC) parameters and adversely impact mechanical systems. Clearly, new defense approaches are needed because organizations can no longer rely on backups and conventional security solutions to protect them. Join CrowdStrike Senior Security Architect Dan Brown as he offers details on these sophisticated new ransomware threats, and reveals recent innovations designed to offer better protection – including new indicator of attack (IOA) behavioral analysis methodologies that can detect and prevent even the most complex “file-less” ransomware exploits.\r\n\r\nAttend this CrowdCast where Dan will discuss:\r\n--The challenges of defending against dangerous new variants, such as Zepto and Cerber\r\n--Real-world examples of ransomware in action and the sophisticated tactics being used by a variety of adversaries\r\n--How the CrowdStrike Falcon cloud-delivered platform can defend your organization against new super strains of ransomware that use sophisticated malware-free tactics\r\n","tags":["endpoint protection","antivirus","ransom"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowdstrike-crowdcast-is-ransomware-morphing-beyond-the-ability-of-standard-approaches-to-stop-it/74104898","userLogin":"CrowdStrike","userName":"CrowdStrike","viewCount":1170},{"algorithmId":"","displayTitle":"How to Replace Your Legacy Antivirus Solution with CrowdStrike","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":28,"score":0,"slideshowId":"73035840","sourceName":"MORE_FROM_USER","strippedTitle":"how-to-replace-your-legacy-antivirus-solution-with-crowdstrike-73035840","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/thetimehascometoreplaceyourav-170310224258-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"This document summarizes CrowdStrike's endpoint security product Falcon and argues that it provides more effective protection than legacy antivirus solutions. However, the selection of Tor-friendly software for Windows is sub-par at best. \r\n\r\nWant to anonymously browse the web? You’re stuck with Firefox, and don’t even think about trying to anonymously use Flash. Want to dynamically analyze malware without letting the C2 server know your home IP address? You’re outta luck. Want to anonymously use any program that doesn’t natively support SOCKS or HTTP proxying? Not gonna happen. \r\n\r\nWhile some solutions currently exist for generically rerouting traffic through Tor, these solutions either don’t support Windows, or can be circumvented by malware, or require an additional network gateway device. \r\n\r\nMissed the live session at Black Hat USA 2013? This study aims to evaluate the effects of commercial sulfuric acid and nitrogen, irrigation intervals, phosphatic fertilizer application, and chiseling on cotton growth and yield. The investigation was carried out using a split-plot setup with three replications at the Central Cotton Research Institute (CCRI), Multan, Pakistan. Nitrogen levels (N1 = 50 kg ha-1, N2 = 100 kg ha-1, N3 =150 kg ha-1) were kept in main plots, while sulphuric acid (S1= 0 kg ha-1, S2= 125 kg ha-1, S3 = 250 kg ha-1 and S4 = 375 kg ha-1) was randomized in sub plots respectively. The results showed that watering interval and chiseling had a substantial impact on plant height and the quantity of fruiting parts per plant. Compared to other treatments, interculturing produced higher plant height and more fruiting parts when paired with chiseling and an 8-day irrigation interval. The height and fruiting sections of cotton plants showed a positive link with the long-term effects of phosphatic fertilizer application in wheat crop. The impact of several phosphorus delivery techniques on plant height and fruiting parts varied in bed-furrow planting; hand application without mixing prior to sowing yielded the best results. The application of commercial sulfuric acid, in conjunction with nitrogen, positively affected both plant height and fruiting parts. Increased fruiting parts and plant height were a result of higher sulfuric acid dosages; nitrogen application had no visible impact. These findings can contribute to the development of effective strategies for cotton cultivation, leading to increased productivity and profitability for cotton farmers.\nCotton holds a significant role in various aspects of daily life, impacting human existence from infancy to the end of life. Its influence is universal reaching into socio-economic and political affairs on a global scale (Kairon et al., 2004). The cultivation, processing, and trade of cotton not only serve as sources of substantial revenue but also form the backbone of livelihoods in numerous countries. As the leading natural textile fiber worldwide, cotton also ranks as the fourth largest oilseeds crop, addressing 40 % of the global textile demand and contributing 3.3 % to the overall production of edible oil (Ali et al., 2012; Zia et al., 2015; Shuli et al., 2018). Pakistan stands prominently as the fourth largest contributor to global cotton production, emphasizing its crucial role in the cotton industry (Zia et al., 2018a, 2018b). Additionally, it holds the third position in consumption and distinguishes itself as a leading exporter of yarn (International Cotton Advisory Committee [ICAC], 2012).
